Container.Name: GluetunVPN
Container.Overview:
# Gluetun VPN client Lightweight swiss-knife-like VPN client to multiple VPN service providers
# Quick links - Setup - https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun-wiki - Problem? - Check the Wiki: https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun-wiki - Start a discussion: https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun/discussions - Fix the Unraid template: https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun/discussions/550 - Suggestion? - Create an issue: https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun/issues - Join the Slack channel: https://join.slack.com/t/qdm12/shared_invite/enQtOTE0NjcxNTM1ODc5LTYyZmVlOTM3MGI4ZWU0YmJkMjUxNmQ4ODQ2OTAwYzMxMTlhY2Q1MWQyOWUyNjc2ODliNjFjMDUxNWNmNzk5MDk - Happy? - Sponsor me: https://github.com/sponsors/qdm12 - Donate: https://www.paypal.me/qmcgaw - Drop me an email: quentin.mcgaw@gmail.com - Want to add a VPN provider? - Check development: https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun-wiki/blob/main/contributing/development.md - Add a provider: https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun-wiki/blob/main/contributing/add-a-provider.md
# Features - Based on Alpine 3.18 for a small Docker image of 35.6MB - Supports: **AirVPN**, **Cyberghost**, **ExpressVPN**, **FastestVPN**, **Giganews**, **HideMyAss**, **IPVanish**, **IVPN**, **Mullvad**, **NordVPN**, **Perfect Privacy**, **Privado**, **Private Internet Access**, **PrivateVPN**, **ProtonVPN**, **PureVPN**, **SlickVPN**, **Surfshark**, **TorGuard**, **VPNSecure.me**, **VPNUnlimited**, **Vyprvpn**, **WeVPN**, **Windscribe** servers - Supports OpenVPN for all providers listed - Supports Wireguard both kernelspace and userspace - For **Mullvad**, **Ivpn**, **Surfshark** and **Windscribe** - For **ProtonVPN**, **PureVPN**, **Torguard**, **VPN Unlimited** and **WeVPN** using the custom provider - For custom Wireguard configurations using the custom provider - More in progress, see: https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun/issues/134 - DNS over TLS baked in with service provider(s) of your choice - DNS fine blocking of malicious/ads/surveillance hostnames and IP addresses, with live update every 24 hours - Choose the vpn network protocol, `udp` or `tcp` - Built in firewall kill switch to allow traffic only with needed the VPN servers and LAN devices - Built in Shadowsocks proxy (protocol based on SOCKS5 with an encryption layer, tunnels TCP+UDP) - Built in HTTP proxy (tunnels HTTP and HTTPS through TCP) - Connect other containers to it - Connect LAN devices to it - Compatible with amd64, i686 (32 bit), **ARM** 64 bit, ARM 32 bit v6 and v7, and even ppc64le ðŸŽ† - Custom VPN server side port forwarding for Private Internet Access - Possibility of split horizon DNS by selecting multiple DNS over TLS providers - Unbound subprogram drops root privileges once launched - Can work as a Kubernetes sidecar container, thanks @rorph
# Setup ðŸŽ‰ There are now instructions specific to each VPN provider with examples to help you get started as quickly as possible!
Go to the Wiki: https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun-wiki ðŸ†• Image also available as `ghcr.io/qdm12/gluetun` # License MIT: https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun/master/LICENSE
Container.DonateText: This app and docker were generously made by qmcgaw. If you like the project please consider making a donation toward his efforts and check out the MANY other projects he has created on GitHub.
Container.Changes:
###3.34.0 - See release notes here: https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun/releases/tag/v3.40.0
###Previous Versions - See previous release notes here: https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun/releases

Config.Name: TIMEZONE
Config.Description: Specify a timezone to use to have correct log times. i.e. Europe/London

Config.Name: config
Config.Description: Container Path: /gluetun

Config.Name: VPN_SERVICE_PROVIDER
Config.Description: VPN Service Provider

Config.Name: VPN_TYPE
Config.Description: VPN Type. Default is OpenVPN. Note not all providers support Wireguard.

Config.Name: VPN_INTERFACE
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Specify a custom network interface name to use. (e.g. tun0 or wg0)

Config.Name: VPN_ENDPOINT_PORT
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Custom OpenVPN/Wireguard server endpoint port to use

Config.Name: VPN_ENDPOINT_IP
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Specify a target VPN IP address to use

Config.Name: OPENVPN_PROTOCOL
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Container Variable: OPENVPN_PROTOCOL

Config.Name: OPENVPN_USER
Config.Description: Container Variable: OPENVPN_USER

Config.Name: OPENVPN_PASSWORD
Config.Description: Container Variable: OPENVPN_PASSWORD (Optional for Mullvad)

Config.Name: OPENVPN_VERSION
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Set the OpenVPN version to run

Config.Name: OPENVPN_VERBOSITY
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: OpenVPN verbosity level

Config.Name: OPENVPN_FLAGS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Space delimited OpenVPN flags to pass to openvpn

Config.Name: OPENVPN_CIPHERS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Specify one or more custom ciphers to use

Config.Name: OPENVPN_AUTH
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Specify a custom auth algorithm to use. i.e. sha256

Config.Name: OPENVPN_PROCESS_USER
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Run OpenVPN as root

Config.Name: OPENVPN_IPV6
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Enable tunneling of IPv6 (only for Mullvad)

Config.Name: OPENVPN_CUSTOM_CONFIG
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: The path to your OpenVPN configuration file. This implies VPN_SERVICE_PROVIDER=custom

Config.Name: WIREGUARD_IMPLEMENTATION
Config.Description: Implementation of Wireguard to use.

Config.Name: WIREGUARD_PRIVATE_KEY
Config.Description: OPTINAL: 32 bytes private key in base64 format

Config.Name: WIREGUARD_PRESHARED_KEY
Config.Description: OPTINAL: 32 bytes pre-shared key in base64 format

Config.Name: WIREGUARD_PUBLIC_KEY
Config.Description: Only for VPN_SERVICE_PROVIDER=custom and VPN_TYPE=wireguard: Wireguard server public key

Config.Name: WIREGUARD_ADDRESSES
Config.Description: Wireguard IP network in the format xx.xx.xx.xx/xx. Wireguard interface address, only required if VPN_TYPE=wireguard. Note this is usually specific by user and the same for all servers.

Config.Name: WIREGUARD_ALLOWED_IPS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: CSV of IP address ranges, only required if VPN_TYPE=wireguard. Note this is usually specific by user and the same for all servers.

Config.Name: WIREGUARD_MTU
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Any positive value up to 65535, only required if VPN_TYPE=wireguard.

Config.Name: WIREGUARD_PERSISTENT_KEEPALIVE_INTERVAL
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Wireguard persistent keepalive interval. i.e. 25s.

Config.Name: SERVER_COUNTRIES
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated list of VPN countries. https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun-wiki

Config.Name: SERVER_CITIES
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated list of VPN cities. https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun-wiki

Config.Name: SERVER_NAMES
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: (PIA ONLY) Single server hostname. https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun-wiki

Config.Name: SERVER_HOSTNAMES
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated list of server hostnames. https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun-wiki

Config.Name: VPN_PORT_FORWARDING
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Enable custom port forwarding code for supported providers. https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun-wiki

Config.Name: VPN_PORT_FORWARDING_LISTENING_PORT
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Port redirection for the VPN server side port forwarded. https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun-wiki

Config.Name: FIREWALL
Config.Description: Turn on or off the container built-in firewall. You should turn off for debugging purposes only.

Config.Name: FIREWALL_VPN_INPUT_PORTS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated list of ports to allow from the VPN server side (useful for vyprvpn port forwarding)

Config.Name: FIREWALL_INPUT_PORTS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated list of ports to allow through the default interface. This seems needed for Unraid containers and Kubernetes sidecars.

Config.Name: FIREWALL_OUTBOUND_SUBNETS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: You first need to set your LAN CIDR in FIREWALL_OUTBOUND_SUBNETS. For example with FIREWALL_OUTBOUND_SUBNETS=192.168.1.0/24

Config.Name: FIREWALL_DEBUG
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Prints every firewall related command. You should use it for debugging purposes only.

Config.Name: LOG_LEVEL
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Container Variable: LOG_LEVEL

Config.Name: DOT
Config.Description: (Recommended: on) Activate DNS over TLS with Unbound

Config.Name: DOT_PROVIDERS
Config.Description: Comma delimited list of DNS over TLS providers

Config.Name: DOT_PRIVATE_ADDRESS
Config.Description: All private CIDRs ranges. Comma separated list of CIDRs or single IP addresses Unbound won't resolve to. Note that the default setting prevents DNS rebinding

Config.Name: DOT_CACHING
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Unbound caching

Config.Name: DOT_IPV6
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: DNS IPv6 resolution

Config.Name: BLOCK_MALICIOUS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Block malicious hostnames and IPs with Unbound

Config.Name: BLOCK_SURVEILLANCE
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Block surveillance hostnames and IPs with Unbound

Config.Name: BLOCK_ADS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Block ads hostnames and IPs with Unbound

Config.Name: UNBLOCK
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated list of domain names to leave unblocked with Unbound. i.e. domain1.com,x.domain2.co.uk

Config.Name: DNS_UPDATE_PERIOD
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Period to update block lists and cryptographic files and restart Unbound. Set to 0 to deactivate updates. i.e. 0, 30s, 5m, 24h

Config.Name: DNS_ADDRESS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: IP address to use as DNS resolver if DOT is off

Config.Name: DNS_KEEP_NAMESERVER
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Keep the nameservers in /etc/resolv.conf untouched, but disabled DNS blocking features

Config.Name: HTTPPROXY
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Enable the internal HTTP proxy

Config.Name: HTTPPROXY_LOG
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Logs every tunnel requests

Config.Name: HTTPPROXY_PORT
Config.Description: Internal port number for the HTTP proxy to listen on

Config.Name: HTTPPROXY_USER
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Username to use to connect to the HTTP proxy

Config.Name: HTTPPROXY_PASSWORD
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Password to use to connect to the HTTP proxy

Config.Name: ENABLE_HTTPPROXY_STEALTH
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Stealth mode means HTTP proxy headers are not added to your requests

Config.Name: SHADOWSOCKS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Enable the internal Shadowsocks proxy

Config.Name: SHADOWSOCKS_LOG
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Enable Shadowsocks logging

Config.Name: SHADOWSOCKS_LISTENING_ADDRESS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Port number for the HTTP proxy to listen on

Config.Name: SHADOWSOCKS_PASSWORD
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Password to use to connect to Shadowsocks

Config.Name: SHADOWSOCKS_CIPHER
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Cipher to use for Shadowsocks

Config.Name: UPDATER_PERIOD
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Period to update all VPN servers information in memory and to /gluetun/servers.json. Set to 0 to disable. This does a burst of DNS over TLS requests, which may be blocked if you set BLOCK_MALICIOUS=on for example. Valid duration string such as 24h.

Config.Name: PORT_FORWARD_ONLY
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Filter only port-forwarding enabled (aka *p2p*) servers (pia and protonvpn only)

Config.Name: VPN_PORT_FORWARDING_STATUS_FILE
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: File path to use for writing the forwarded port obtained. https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun-wiki

Config.Name: VPN_PORT_FORWARDING_UP_COMMAND
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Command to run when port forwarding has finished setting up (pia and protonvpn only). https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun-wiki

Config.Name: VPN_PORT_FORWARDING_DOWN_COMMAND
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Command to run when port forwarding has finished tearing down (pia and protonvpn only). https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun-wiki

Config.Name: VPN_PORT_FORWARDING_PROVIDER
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Choose the custom port forwarding code to use. This is useful when using the custom provider with Wireguard. For PIA, make sure you set SERVER_NAMES=xxxx. https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun-wiki

Config.Name: VPN_PORT_FORWARDING_USERNAME
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: This is needed when using the custom provider with Wireguard with PIA. https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun-wiki

Config.Name: VPN_PORT_FORWARDING_PASSWORD
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: This is needed when using the custom provider with Wireguard with PIA. https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun-wiki

Config.Name: HEALTH_SERVER_ADDRESS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Internal Health Server Listening Addroess

Config.Name: HEALTH_TARGET_ADDRESS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Address used to check tunnel health

Config.Name: HEALTH_VPN_DURATION_INITIAL
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Initial health check duration in seconds.

Config.Name: HEALTH_VPN_DURATION_ADDITION
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Subsequent health check duration in seconds.

Config.Name: PUBLICIP_FILE
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Filepath to store the public IP address assigned

Config.Name: PUBLICIP_PERIOD
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Period to check for public IP address. Set to 0 to disable.

Config.Name: VERSION_INFORMATION
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Filepath to store the public IP address assigned

Config.Name: HTTP_CONTROL_SERVER_PORT
Config.Description: Container Port: 8000

Config.Name: HTTP_CONTROL_SERVER_LOG
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Enable logging of HTTP requests

Config.Name: PUID
Config.Description: Container Variable: PUID

Config.Name: PGID
Config.Description: Container Variable: PGID
